scenarioDescription:
The GJ 3779 Exoplanetary System


Overview

GJ 3779 is a star with 0.27 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.28 times its radius. It is located 44.82 light years away from the solar system.

GJ 3779 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the GJ 3779 system


GJ 3779 b

GJ 3779 b was discovered by the Calar Alto Observatory observatory, in 2018-12, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.03 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of GJ 3779 b is 8.004 times the mass of Earth. The radius of GJ 3779 b is 2.750 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, GJ 3779 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system GJ 3779, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Calar Alto Observatory.
name: GJ 3779 - System With 1 Exoplanet
